frame.name: Change_operational_state
frame.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Device</fen> or machine is put in (or out of) service either by a volitional <fen>Agent</fen> or by a <fen>Cause</fen> event or force acting on the <fen>Device</fen>. The <fen>Time</fen> when and the <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Device</fen> is put in or out of use may be specified, as may be the <fen>Purpose</fen> of the human <fen>Agent</fen> in changing the operational state of the <fen>Device</fen>.
<ex>The laborer realized that <fex name="age">he</fex> <t>activated</t> <fex name="Device">the machine</fex> but did not know how to stop it.</ex>
</def-root>

FE.name: Device
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Device</fen> or machine that is in or out of operation.
<ex><fex name="Device">The night lights</fex> were <t>turned</t> <t>on</t> in the secondary school.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Time</fen> when a <fen>Device</fen> is put into or out of operation.
<ex>My dad <t>turned</t> the lights <t>on</t> for me <fex name="Time">at 10 o'clock</fex> </ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Place</fen> in which the <fen>Device</fen> is put into or out of operation.
<ex>Suddenly, the lights <m>got</m> <t>turned</t> <t>on</t> <fex name="Place">on the Jamaica road bridge</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Agent
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Agent</fen> is the person who changes the operational state of the <fen>Device</fen>.
<ex>Instantly <fex name="age">Sue</fex> <t>activated</t> the commlink on the wall.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Cause
FE.definition:
<def-root><fen>Cause</fen> identifies the non-agentive force that causes the <fen>Device</fen> to begin to operate.
<ex>He was in his stocking feet while standing in the bayou that formed when <fex name="Cause">the wind</fex> <t>turned</t> the shower <t>on</t> in that one upstairs bathroom.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Purpose
FE.definition:
<def-root>The FE <fen>Purpose</fen> denotes a state of affairs that the <fen>Agent</fen> wants to bring about by putting the <fen>Device</fen> into operation.
<ex>They then <t>activated</t> the beacon <fex name="pur">in order to inform the International coastguard of their position</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Explanation
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Explanation</fen> denotes a proposition from which the event of the <fen>Device</fen>'s being caused to operate or cease to operate logically follows.
<ex>It works great for this price, I haven't <t>activated</t> the cable box <fex name="Explanation">because analog cable works like any TV tuner would</fex>. </ex></def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition:
<def-root>Any description of the event (or state) which is not covered by more specific FEs, including force (<ment>hard</ment>, <ment>softly</ment>), secondary effects (<ment>quietly</ment>, <ment>loudly</ment>), and general descriptions comparing events (<ment>the same way</ment>). In agentive uses, it may indicate salient characteristics of an <fen>Agent</fen> that also affect the action (<ment>deliberately</ment>, <ment>eagerly</ment>, <ment>carefully</ment>).
<ex>I <fex name="Manner">carefully</fex> <t>turned</t> <t>off</t> the computers, turned off the lights, locked that back door, and went to my office to do the paper work.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition: <def-root>The degree to which the <fen>Device</fen> is active after the action.</def-root>

FE.name: Means
FE.definition:
<def-root>An action done by the Agent in order to cause the Device to being to operate.
<ex>He <t>activated</t> the machine <fex name="Means">by pulling the lever</fex>.</ex></def-root>
